result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua Emanuel Norman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery to Public Transit Passenger, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(6)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments, DNA surcharge  To be collected during term of probation.
 If defendant  is revoked, to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
*Restitution set at zero.

Obtain/maintain employment as long as it does not interfer with Social Security benefits.
Vocational assessment.  Participate in any programs recommended.

Provide DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess an firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Mental health assessment.  Cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications but only in dosages presribed by a physician.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No association with drug usrs, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing.
No contact with Dion T.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua Emanuel Norman

defendant.name: Norman, Joshua Emanuel
defendant.address: 7708 West National Avenue #16, West Allis, WI 53214

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per Written Explanation Sheet in file, Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Wisconsin Substance Abuse programs.

Defendant Joshua Emanuel Norman in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Joshua Emanuel Norman in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 40 MONTHS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 16 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 24 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 113  DAYS time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 3 YEARS with the following conditions:
-Restitution set at $0 
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments to be collected during term probation.  If defendant is revoked, all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation.  If defendant is revoked, all related surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain employment as long as it does not interfer with social security benefits. 
-Vocational assessment; participate in any programs recommended
-Mental health assessment and  cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications but only in dosages prescribed by a physician
-No contact with Dion T.
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felonhe may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
 Filed, Pretrial Credit sheet
Sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-19-2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

BRANCH 26 for BRANCH 21:

Defendant Joshua Emanuel Norman in court with Attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Joshua Emanuel Norman in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Branch 26 prepared to proceed to sentencing.
Statements to the Court.  Victim has not been properly notified.  Court declines to proceed with sentencing.
Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 21.
Clerk:  jms

Case was going to be heard before Judge Pocan in Branch 26. Parties notified and case sent forthwith. Branch 26 informed the Branch 21 that victim notification was not made so the sentencing was not able to proceed. Sentencing is scheduled for 08/19/15 at 8:30 in Branch 21.

Defendant Joshua Emanuel Norman in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Report from Dr. Pankiewicz submitted by the defense received and filed.

Attorney Clair H. Voss in court, defendant Joshua Emanuel Norman not in court, in custody.  
Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations. 
Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.
  Plea hearing scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Case was mistakingly tabbed to Branch 22, transfered to Branch 21.

Defendant Joshua Emanuel Norman in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Joshua Emanuel Norman in custody.  Ronald Dague for Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Benjamin Rebholz-Wauwatosa Police Department Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DION T.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.

Defendant Joshua Emanuel Norman in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Joshua Emanuel Norman in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WITKOWIAK, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

COURT ORDERS DNA SAMPLE TO BE COLLECTED.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
